I agree with your translation, "Assessing underperforming students," as the most accurate English equivalent of the Chinese text "考察落后的学生." 

Firstly, the term "考察" in Chinese can be translated as "assess" or "evaluate" in English, which implies a thorough examination or investigation. In this context, it suggests a detailed assessment of the students.

Secondly, the term "落后的" in Chinese means "falling behind" or "underperforming," indicating that the students being referred to are not meeting the expected standards or are lagging behind their peers.
